FuncDef:
The vrrp vrid track ipsec-instance command makes a VRRP backup group to track an IPSec instance and adjust its priority.
The undo vrrp vrid track ipsec-instance command restores the default setting.
By default, a VRRP backup group does not track the status of an IPSec instance.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the ID of a VRRP backup group.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255.

Specifies the ID of the bound IPSec instance.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 128.

Specifies the value by which the VRRP priority reduces if the tracked IPSec instance goes Down.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255. By default, the VRRP priority reduces by 10 if the tracked IPSec instance goes Down.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
Generally, IPSec tunnels are established to ensure the privacy, completeness, authenticity, and anti-relay of packets; the VRRP ensures the device-level reliability. When VRRP and IPSec tunnel are deployed on a same network, the status of an IPSec instance must be tracked by the VRRP backup group, which ensures the VRRP backup group can perform a master/slave switchover based on the status of the IPSec instance.
Based on the status of the IPSec instance, the VRRP backup group adjusts its priority and switches the master and slave devices, ensuring that traffic can be protected.
Before configuring a VRRP backup group to track the status of an IPSec instance, confirm that there is a VSU on the device and the IPSec instance has been configured.
After the vrrp vrid track ipsec-instance command is run:
If the tracked IPSec instance goes Down, the VRRP backup group will adjust its priority based on the value by which the VRRP priority reduces, then, new master and slave devices will be selected.If the tracked IPSec instance keeps Up, the VRRP priority remains the same.If the tracked IPSec instance is in the Delete state, the VRRP uses the original priority, and deletes the binding relationship with the IPSec instance.
Run the undo vrrp vrid track ipsec-instance command, and the VRRP backup group uses the original priority and deletes the binding relationship.
